verses.verse: {The Book of the Prophet} {Obadiah} d {Coming Judgment against Edom} d Obadiah's {1 The Heb. name Obadiah means Servant of the Lord} vision: This is what the Lord God has to say about Edom. We have heard a report from the Lord, and a messenger has been dispatched among the nations to say {1 The Heb. lacks to say} "Get up! Let us rise up against her to fight!"
{God's Announcement to Edom} d "Look! I will make you insignificant among the nations; you will be utterly despised.

The arrogance in your heart has deceived you, who inhabit hidden places on rocky cliffs, whose dwelling is in the heights, who say continually to yourself, {3 Lit. continually in your heart} Â«Who will bring me down to the ground? '
Though you soar high like the eagle and make your nest among the stars, I will bring you down even from there," declares the Lord . {4 Cf. Jer 49:14-16}

{The Harvest from Edom's Arrogance} d "If thieves came against you, if marauding gangs by night Oh, how you will be destroyed! Would they not steal only until they had enough? If grape pickers came to you, would they not leave some {5 The Heb. lacks some} grapes to be gleaned?
"Oh, how Esau is ransacked, how his hidden treasures are thoroughly {6 The Heb. lacks thoroughly} searched out!

All your allies will force you out of the land, {7 Lit. out to the border} your associates will deceive you and prevail against you. Your friends {7 Lit. Your bread ; i. e. those who eat your bread} will lay out a trap for you, and you will {7 The Heb. lacks you will} never understand it!
"In that day,"declares the Lord , "will I not destroy the wise from Edom, and those with understanding from Esau's Mountain?
Teman, our mighty soldiers will be dismayed, so that every man from Esau's Mountain will be slaughtered." {9 Lit. will be cut off by slaughter}
{Judgment for Edom's Cruelty to Jacob} d "Shame will overwhelm you because of the violence you inflicted on your brother Jacob, and you will be excluded {10 Lit. cut off} forever.

"On the day you just stood by, {11 Or stood in opposition} when {11 Lit. in the day} strangers carried away Jacob's {11 Lit. his} wealth and foreigners entered his gates, casting lots for Jerusalem, you were just like one of them.

"You should not have gloated over your brother, {12 Lit. in the day of your brother} on the day of his calamity. You should not have rejoiced when {12 Lit. in the day} the descendants of Judah were perishing. You should not have boasted {12 Lit. have let your mouth boast} when {12 Lit. in the day} they were in distress.

"You should not have entered the gate of my people on the day of their disaster. {13 The Heb. words their disaster may be a word play on the Heb. word Edom} Also, you should not have gloated over Judah's {13 Lit. his} misfortune on the day of his disaster, {13 The Heb. words his disaster may be a word play on the Heb. word Edom} nor should you have plundered his wealth on the day of his disaster. {13 The Heb. words his disaster may be a word play on the Heb. word Edom}
And you should not have taken your stand at the crossroads to cut down his fleeing refugees, nor should you have handed over his survivors on the day of his distress."

{The Lord's Judgment and Israel's Final Victory} d "Indeed, the Day of the Lord approaches all nations. As you have done it will be done to you your deeds will return to haunt you! {15 Lit. return on your own head}

Just as you have drunk from the cup of my wrath {16 The Heb. lacks from the cup of my wrath} upon my holy mountain, so will all nations drink from the cup of my wrath {16 The Heb. lacks from the cup of my wrath} perpetually. They will drink, they will gulp it down, and they will be as if they had never existed!
"But there will be a delivered remnant on Mount Zion. There will be holiness, and the house of Jacob will take back their possessions.

"The house of Jacob will be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, but the house of Esau will be kindling. Then Jacob and Joseph {18 Lit. They} will burn and consume Esau, {18 Lit. them} and no survivor will remain from the house of Esau." Indeed, the Lord has spoken it.

"Those in the Negev {19 I. e. the southern regions of the Sinai peninsula; cf. Josh 10:40} will possess Esau's Mountain, and those in the Shephelah {19 I. e. the verdant central lowlands of Israel; cf. Josh 10:40} the Philistines. They will possess the fields of Ephraim and the fields of Samaria, while Benjamin will possess the territory of {19 The Heb. lacks will possess the territory of} Gilead.

The exiles, the Israeli host, will possess the territory of the {20 The Heb. lacks the territory of} Canaanites all the way to Zarephath. The exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad {20 I. e. perhaps Sardis, capital of Lydia, Saparda in eastern Assyria, Sparta in Greece, or a location in Spain (so Targ of Jonathan )} will possess the cities of the Negev. {20 I. e. the southern regions of the Sinai peninsula; cf. Josh 10:40}
Deliverers will assemble on Mount Zion to judge Esau's Mountain, and to the Lord will the kingdom belong!"
